DataElement.preferredName: Person Clinical Trial Acute Myeloid Leukemia Refractory Disease Stratification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the classification patients by refractory disease of a quickly progressing disease in which too many immature blood-forming cells are found in the blood and bone marrow, into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Clinical Trial Acute Myeloid Leukemia Refractory Disease Stratification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the process of classifying patients by refractory disease of a quickly progressing disease in which too many immature blood-forming cells are found in the blood and bone marrow.

Property.preferredName: Clinical Trial Acute Myeloid Leukemia Refractory Disease Stratification
Property.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.:A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:No Value Exists:The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.

A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the classification of patients participating in the type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people with refractory disease actue myeloid leukemia, into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.
